intro: Fleischmannia sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert in North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Fleischmannia sonorae plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
